item.title: 🌱 Git in Modern Development
item.description:
Why Git Changed Development

As a computer vision developer, I deal daily with the need to:

  • Experiment with different approaches without the fear of “breaking” working code
  • Collaborate on algorithms with colleagues
  • Track changes in complex mathematical models

Git handles these tasks better than any of its predecessors.

Evolution of VCS: From RCS to Git

Local Systems (RCS)

  • ✔️ Simplicity
  • ✖️ No team collaboration
  • ✖️ Risk of history loss

Centralized Systems (SVN)

  • ✔️ Shared codebase
  • ✖️ Single point of failure
  • ✖️ Internet dependency

Distributed Systems (Git)

  • ✔️ Full history on every developer’s machine
  • ✔️ Work offline
  • ✔️ Flexible workflows (GitHub Flow, Git Flow)

Practical Aspects of Git

What I Like:

  1. Branching – I create feature branches for each experiment
  2. Staging area – precise control over commits
  3. .gitignore – keeps temporary model files out of version control
